fo:block.fo:inline: The intent of this indicative and non-binding term sheet

dated 11th November 2024 is to describe, for negotiation purposes only, some key terms of the proposed agreement to be entered into between Grand Anicut Trust/Fund 4 and/or its affiliates, a Category - II Alternative Investment Fund registered with the Securities and Exchange Board of India (

), a company incorporated under the Companies Act, 1956 or Companies Act, 2013, as the case may be and having its registered office at Kumbakonam,TamilNadu-600234 with respect to the proposed investment/s by the Investor in the Company (

). The transaction contemplated herein, is subject to, among other things: (a) the completion of legal, financial and tax due diligence process satisfactory to the Investor in its sole and absolute discretion; (b) procurement of internal approvals by the Investor; and (c) the execution of, and satisfaction of conditions mentioned in, the appropriate definitive agreements (

). Notwithstanding anything to the contrary, any obligations of the Company to complete any transaction, whether contemplated herein or otherwise, are subject to the parties hereto having negotiated, approved, executed and delivered the Definitive Documents and such Definitive Documents remaining in full force and effect. Further, nothing contained herein shall constitute an offer to buy or sell the securities described in this Term Sheet.
This Term Sheet shall remain valid up to
from the date hereof, however, the same can be extended by additional

at the option of the Investor. If this Term Sheet remains unsigned after that time, Investor at its option may immediately terminate discussions with the Company or change any or all pricing, terms and conditions contained herein. Notwithstanding the foregoing, the Investor shall have the right to terminate this Term Sheet at any time before the expiry of the aforesaid period, at its sole and absolute discretion, without any liability or obligation whatsoever.

fo:table-cell.fo:block: Grand Anicut Trust/Fund 4 and/or its affiliates
30 NCDs, at par for cash in dematerialized form by Issuer

fo:table-cell.fo:block: Growth Capital and my Flow Testpostman

fo:block.fo:block: The NCDs shall be secured by:

fo:list-item-body.fo:block: Pledge of shares in the COCO Pvt. Ltd. amounting to 10% of fully diluted share holding.
Issue of demand promissory note by the Company;

Post-dated cheques for monthly coupon payments and principal payment instalments and an undated cheque for the entire Investment Amount; and such other security as may be created under the Definitive Documents

fo:table-cell.fo:block: 5 (Five) cumulative calendar days during the tenor of NCDS to repay principal amount of NCDs and/or the Coupon. Default Interest shall be payable for the period of delay.
0.25% (Zero Point Two Five per cent) Per Month in the event of any delay in repayment of the Investment Amount or part there of, or payment of Coupon and upon occurrence of any other Event of Default

fo:block.fo:block: There will be no restriction on the ability of Investor to transfer all or any of the Debentures held by it along with rights attached to such Debentures to any person.

The obligation of the Investor to invest in the Company shall be subject to inter alia, the following conditions. Notwithstanding the generality of the foregoing, the Investor may enjoin such other conditions upon the Company, prior to making the investment, as it deems fit.

fo:table-cell.fo:block: The Investor shall complete a detailed due diligence covering business, financial, legal and tax areas, to its satisfaction.
Finalization of business plan for 12 months from date of investment of the Investment Amount. &
The Definitive Documents will contain customary representations, warranties, indemnities, undertakings and covenants, together with deal-specific provisions arising from the due diligence exercise.
The Proposed Transaction must be approved by Investor's investment committee and by the board of directors and shareholders of the Company.

The drafting charges for the Definitive Documents, shall be borne by the Company. The Company shall also bear all other costs and expenses pertaining to the Proposed Transaction, including the stamp duty.

Any dispute arising out of this Term Sheet shall be subject arbitration of a sole arbitrator mutually appointed by the parties herein. The Arbitration shall be held in Chennai, India, and the language of the proceedings shall be in English. The arbitration shall be conducted in accordance with the provisions of the Arbitration and Conciliation Act, 1996.
The laws of India. Subject to Clause 5.2 above, the courts in Chennai shall have exclusive jurisdiction.

The Company agrees, acknowledges and understands to not negotiate or enter into or continue discussions with any other person or entity or solicit or encourage, directly or indirectly, or furnish information to any other person or entity, with respect to transactions and arrangements contemplated in this Term Sheet, during the period of 7 days following the date of execution of this Term Sheet.

The parties shall keep confidential at all times the fact that the parties herein have executed this Term Sheet, the terms of this Term Sheet and the existence and content of any negotiations between both the parties except that both parties may (i) inform advisors, counsels, and employees with a need to know as each party deems necessary, and (ii) make appropriate disclosures if required by applicable laws.
